comment._content: Lady Eustace Percy would be Stella Drummond Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eustace_Percy,_1st_Baron_Percy_of_N...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "John Barrett (November 28, 1866 – October 17, 1938) was a United States diplomat and one of the most influential early directors general of the Pan American Union." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Barrett_%28diplomat%29 The photo was taken in front of the Pan American Union building in Washington (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_American_Union_Building, Streetview: maps.google.com/maps?q=17th+Street+NW&ll=38.892893,-7...) The photo is perhaps taken at the same occasion as this (and others, see comments):

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The woman on the photo is much too old to be Stella Katherine Drummond. She was born in 1895, see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurence_Drummond and records.ancestry.com/Stella_Katherine_Drummond_records.as.... She married Lord Eustache Percy not before 1918. Eustache Percy was third secretary of the British embassy at Washington in 1913, see e.g. The Washington times., November 14, 1913, LAST AND HOME EDITION, Page 12, but this woman could rather be his mother.
